channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: Picture gallery: Amiga prototype "Lorraine" at the Amiga 40 event
item.description:
de - Picture gallery: Amiga prototype "Lorraine" at the Amiga 40 DEUTSCHE VERSION Links| Forums| Comments| Report news Chat| Polls| Newsticker| Archive [Login] [Register] [Forgot your password. org (Webseite) Picture gallery: Amiga prototype "Lorraine" at the Amiga 40 Dale Luck from the original Amiga development team has preserved the very first Amiga prototype, which used three huge stacks of well-equipped breadboards instead of custom chips. Amiga user ‘Pittrock’ took pictures of the exhibit and kindly gave us permission to publish them here: (cg) [News message: 23.

Read more

item.title: Microsoft Releases AI Call Center Stack with Voice, SMS, and Memory
item.description:
Call Center AI AI-powered call center solution with Azure and OpenAI GPT. Overview Send a phone call from AI agent, in an API call. Or, directly call the bot from the configured phone number.

Read more

item.title: Criminal complaint against facial recognition company Clearview AI
item.description:
Several EU data protection authorities have already imposed fines and bans on Clearview AI. EU data protection authorities have already repeatedly held that Clearview AI, which processed the data of millions of Europeans, clearly violated the GDPR. The Austrian data protection authority considered that Clearview AI has acted illegally.

Read more

item.title: Linux VM without VM software – User Mode Linux
item.description:
The kernel determines the underlying hardware (e. This hardware can also be entirely virtual. UML - Kernel in a Userspace Process Personally, I view UML as a paravirtualized kernel configuration.

Read more

item.title: Show HN: Ordered – A sorted collection library for Zig
item.description:
Sorted collections are data structures that maintain the data in sorted order. Examples of these data structures are `java. These data structures are mainly used for fast lookups (point search) and fast range searches.
